dashboard.steps.stepsToGetStarted.button: Add as a content folder to Front Matter
dashboard.steps.stepsToGetStarted.initia: Initialize the project will create the required files and folders for using the Front Matter CMS. Start by clicking on this action.
dashboard.steps.stepsToGetStarted.framew: Select your site-generator or framework to prefill some of the recommended settings.
dashboard.steps.stepsToGetStarted.assets: Select the folder containing your assets. This folder will be used to store all your media files for your articles.
In case you want to configure another folder, you can do this manually in the frontmatter.json file.
dashboard.steps.stepsToGetStarted.conten: Add one of the folders we found in your project as a content folder. Once a folder is set, Front Matter can be used to list all contents and allow you to create content.
You can also perform this action by right-clicking on the folder in the explorer view, and selecting register folder
dashboard.steps.stepsToGetStarted.tags.d: Now that Front Matter knows all the content folders. Would you like to import all tags and categories from the available content?
dashboard.steps.stepsToGetStarted.showDa: Once all actions are completed, the dashboard can be loaded.
dashboard.steps.stepsToGetStarted.templa: Select a template to prefill the frontmatter.json file with the recommended settings.
